the.knights.tour

Class Knight

  • java.lang.Object
    • the.knights.tour.Knight

  • public class Knight
extends java.lang.Object

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Knight()
      The overloaded Knight constructor sets the initial location to row 0 and col 0.
      Knight(int option)
      The overloaded Knight constructor accepts an integer to enable the debug features of the program.
      Knight(int row, int col)
      The overloaded Knight constructor accepts an initial location different than row 0, col 0;
      Knight(int row, int col, int option)
      The overloaded Knight constructor accpets three integers, the first two are the initial location and the third is an option to turn on the debug features of the program.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      int getCol()
      getCol() method returns the current column as an integer.
      int getRow()
      getRow() method returns the current row as an integer.
      boolean legalMove(int row, int col)
      legalMove() method receives two integers that correspond to a location on the board.
      boolean move(ChessBoard board)
      Move() method receives a ChessBoard object and then checks to see what moves are available.
      java.lang.String toString()
      toString() is an overridden method that returns a formatted string of the row and column.

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • Knight

        public Knight()
        The overloaded Knight constructor sets the initial location to row 0 and col 0.

      • Knight

        public Knight(int option)
        The overloaded Knight constructor accepts an integer to enable the debug features of the program. It then calls the empty constructor to set the location to row 0 and column 0.
        Parameters:
        option -

      • Knight

        public Knight(int row,
              int col)
        The overloaded Knight constructor accepts an initial location different than row 0, col 0;
        Parameters:
        row - row to place knight
        col - column to place the knight

      • Knight

        public Knight(int row,
              int col,
              int option)
        The overloaded Knight constructor accpets three integers, the first two are the initial location and the third is an option to turn on the debug features of the program.
        Parameters:
        row - set initial row location.
        col - set initial column location.
        option - if 1 is received it will turn on the debug feature.

    • Method Detail

      • getRow

        public int getRow()
        getRow() method returns the current row as an integer.
        Returns:
        an integer that corresponds to the row location of the Knight.

      • getCol

        public int getCol()
        getCol() method returns the current column as an integer.
        Returns:
        an integer that corresponds to the column location of the Knight.

      • legalMove

        public boolean legalMove(int row,
                         int col)
        legalMove() method receives two integers that correspond to a location on the board. It then checks whether a move is legal.
        Parameters:
        row - receives an integer that corresponds to a row location on the board
        col - receives an integer that corresponds to a column location on the board
        Returns:
        returns true if the Knight can move to this location, false if it cannot.

      • move

        public boolean move(ChessBoard board)
        Move() method receives a ChessBoard object and then checks to see what moves are available. It then selects one at random and moves the knight to the new location on the board.
        Parameters:
        board - receives a board object to move the knight on.

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        toString() is an overridden method that returns a formatted string of the row and column.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        a string with the format "row column"
